meanings.definition: Make something more attractive or beautiful.
meanings.sent1: She used colorful flowers to prettify her garden.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to prettify the plain wall with a mural.
meanings.sent3: He tried to prettify his messy room by hiding everything under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The sunset prettified the sky with shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The fairy's magic wand could instantly prettify anything it touched.

meanings.definition: To improve the appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: Adding a fresh coat of paint can prettify an old fence.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer suggested some new curtains to prettify the room.
meanings.sent3: She used glitter to prettify her project, making it sparkle.
meanings.sent4: A smile can prettify a face more than any makeup.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze seemed to prettify the entire garden, making it more inviting.
